summary: This is an email exchange between G. Max and Philip Levine discussing a third party (likely a young woman) who is seeking an internship, with G. Max suggesting she should 'irritate' Levine about it and be 'hopefully accommodating'. The document appears to show coordination regarding potential access or favors.

persons.name: G. Max
persons.context: Email sender who informs Philip Levine about a third party meeting him and suggests she should ask for an internship, implying she should be accommodating.

persons.name: Philip Levine
persons.context: Email recipient who is told about a meeting with a third party and that she may ask him for a fashion internship.

connections.description: Communicating via email about coordinating a meeting and potential internship for a third party.

events.title: Email coordination about internship meeting
events.description: G. Max emails Philip Levine to inform him that a third party (likely a young woman) is meeting him and should ask about a fashion internship, with the expectation she will be 'hopefully accommodating'.

keyFacts: The email discusses arranging for a young woman to meet Philip Levine and ask him for a fashion internship.
G. Max suggests the woman should 'irritate' Levine about the internship and be 'hopefully accommodating'.
The tone and phrasing imply a transactional or expectation-laden dynamic regarding the internship request.
The document date is 2001, during the period when Epstein was actively recruiting young women.
